moves.2... d6: Philidor's defence. I'm only semi-familiar with this move.
moves.6. Bc4: Clears kingside for castling and threatens f pawn, but is this OK?
moves.7... Nc6 8. Nxc6: Is this bad, because it gives LSB a better square?
moves.10. Bg5 h6 11. Bxf6: Now I know this is bad, as it gives black the bishop pair advantage AND puts DSB on better square.
moves.15... Bxc3 16. bxc3: Now only the heavyweight pieces are left on the board.
moves.19. Rac1: Major 'oops' moment happened at this point. I pressed the wrong square. Luckily not too detrimental to my position.
moves.19... Re8 20. Rcd1: I move rook to intended square.
moves.26. Rf8 Rxc2 27. Rxf7 Rxa2 28. Rxb7 Rc2: Here my opponent offered a draw, which I accepted. Feel free to comment and give constructive criticism.
